meanings.definition: Capable of being drawn back or in
meanings.sent1: The retractable leash allowed the dog to move freely within a certain distance.
meanings.sent2: The retractable antenna on the radio could be extended for better reception.
meanings.sent3: The retractable straw was a hit at the party, making everyone curious to try it.
meanings.sent4: Her retractable smile faded as soon as she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The retractable roof of the stadium opened up like a giant umbrella, revealing the clear blue sky above.

meanings.definition: Able to be withdrawn or pulled back
meanings.sent1: The retractable seatbelt kept the passengers safe during the sudden stop.
meanings.sent2: The retractable ladder made it easy for the firefighters to reach the top floor.
meanings.sent3: The retractable pen amused the students, who kept clicking it in and out during the lecture.
meanings.sent4: His retractable offer was quickly taken back once he realized the consequences.
meanings.sent5: The retractable bridge allowed the castle to be protected from invaders, as it could be pulled back at any moment.

meanings.definition: That can be retracted or drawn back
meanings.sent1: The retractable table saved space in the small apartment when not in use.
meanings.sent2: The retractable claws of the cat helped it catch prey without causing harm to itself.
meanings.sent3: The retractable belt buckle provided a fun distraction for the child during the long car ride.
meanings.sent4: His retractable excuses were running out as he tried to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The retractable stairs folded neatly into the wall, revealing a hidden passage to the attic.
